intro: Hexaphylla cyrenaica, commonly known as the Cyrenaica hexaphylla, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to the Mediterranean region, particularly found in countries like Libya and Egypt. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
